VPR.Q: What is the overall spatial distribution pattern shown in the heatmap?
VPR.A: The heatmap shows a {horizontal gradient} pattern.

EVJ.Q: What is the global maximum heat value in the heatmap?
EVJ.A: The global maximum heat value is {0.80}.

EVJ.Q: What is the global minimum heat value in the heatmap?
EVJ.A: The global minimum heat value is {0.23}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum heat value for label Consumption on the y-axis?
EVJ.A: The maximum heat value for Consumption on the y-axis is {0.77}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum heat value of label Transmission on the x-axis?
EVJ.A: The maximum heat value of Transmission on the x-axis is {0.42}.

SC.Q: What is the average heat value for label Reliability on the y-axis?
SC.A: The average heat value for Reliability on the y-axis is {0.52}.

SC.Q: What is the average heat value for label Gas on the x-axis?
SC.A: The average heat value for Gas on the x-axis is {0.55}.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Water and Policy or the cell corresponding to Exploration and Production?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Exploration} and {Production} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Water and Policy or the cell corresponding to Nuclear and Production?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Nuclear} and {Production} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Nuclear and Policy or the cell corresponding to Transmission and Reliability?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Nuclear} and {Policy} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Exploration and Policy or the cell corresponding to Renewables and Reliability?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Exploration} and {Policy} has a higher heat value.

MSR.Q: In the heatmap, what are the row and column labels for all cells whose heat values fall within the range of 0.29 to 0.31?
MSR.A: The cells are: {(Waste Management, Emissions), (Waste Management, Production), (Waste Management, Reliability)}.
